result.execSummary:
The defendant John Charles Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 176 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with any co-actors or any victims. No Violent contact with any family members. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintai employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: from WCTC dated 10/6/15

Defendant John Charles Williams in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  Attorney Martinez recites some minor changes to Presentence Investigation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

 4 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 176 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   3  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actors or any victims
____No violent contact with any family members
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 10-09-2015 01:30 pm
Sentencing hearing at 10-09-2015 01:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John Charles Williams in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #4 is dismissed and read-in.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Court sets sentencing date. Bail remains as fixed. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Dated today, from the Court to the Defendant, in response to inmate correspondence received on 08/12/15. Request denied, Court will not re-address or reinstate huber bailee status at this time.
WC inmate communication received today from the Defendant regarding Huber Bailee status.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John Charles Williams in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence hearing, however the state has not complied with victims rights legislation.  Attorney Martinez requests a speedy trial, as well as a rescheduled plea and sentence date.  Attorney Martinez informs the court that the jail is not allowing huber bailee status for Defendant, as the court previously ordered.  Court informs the defense that huber is still discretionary under the jails rules.  Attorney Martinez may provide further verification and court would address.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with codefendants/victims/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  MODIFIED CONDITION:  Defendant allowed huber bailee status for employment and education purposes.

Defendant John Charles Williams in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez requests a plea and sentence date, as well as requesting huber bailee status for Defendant.  State does not object.  Court modifies bail to grant huber bailee status.  Court sets plea and sentence date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
(Orig.) ... for huber bailee status. Filed by Atty Martinez.
Hearing on June 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John Charles Williams in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas K. Martinez.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective MIchelle Trussoni from the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testified. Cross examination. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. Testimony closed. State moves for bind over. Closing statements presented.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Received today, from the Defendant, regarding bond. CC to DA and Atty Martinez.
